website_summaries.verdict: The LSX girl's Mongoose is not designed for stunts or racing, but it does provide a smooth ride over flat and moderately hilly terrain. We suggest upgrading the braking system for younger riders.
pros: Frame is very sturdy, provides a smooth ride
Extremely easy to assemble with minimal tools
Great price for a genuine Mongoose
cons: Some critical components made from cheaper material
Single rear hand brake system, not ideal for younger riders

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike
customer_reviews.text: My son LIVES it. I originally bought it for myself and I gave it to my son after I saw his eyes light up. Great bike for the price. Only one thing I would do away with is all the Allen wrench parts, especially the handle bars. Otherwise love it
customer_reviews.author: Jason Poswencyk

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: All the negative reviews seem to be with assembling the bike. With the right size allen wrench.. for the more mechanically inclined type, it's very simple. If you've never assembled brake lines before, it might take a bit more effort, but still should be pretty easy. Assembly took me roughly 10 minutes. A little pro tip: Do not try and tighten the allen bolts with make shift tools.. it'll be impossible without the right size allen wrench. You will break flathead tips and strip the heads. It takes a great bit of torque to tighten enough that handlebars don't move and loosen when doing bunny hops and wheelies. Great product from the best brand for freestyle.
customer_reviews.author: James Hinman

customer_reviews.title: They were perfect for their size which is 50 inches tall
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these bicycles for my 9 year old twin granddaughters. They were perfect for their size which is 50 inches tall. We had to lower the seat all the way down and adjust the handle bars back a little. So there is plenty of adjustment for future growth. The bikes arrived as scheduled and were in perfect condition. Some assembly, but nothing too difficult. About 15 minutes from unpack to ride per bike.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana Joan

customer_reviews.title: Birthday bike
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for a starter. Nice looking, well made, reasonably easy to put together. Good quality. My grandson loves it, so that's pretty much the bottom line.
customer_reviews.author: Les Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Not a True BMX Freestyle Bike - If you want to do tricks stay away
customer_reviews.text: My son got very interested in Freestyle and wanted to do tricks. The front brakes are cheap and not strong enough to do any true tricks. I ended up taking this to the bike store and they could not get the brakes any tighter then I could. The front wheel was not true and was slightly bent when it arrived. The bike looks great and if your son is only looking for a bike to ride around the neighborhood this is fine ( but overpriced then ) , but if he wants to do even the most basic of tricks ... STAY AWAY !!! I returned the bike and would never recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Defective part
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday gift for my grandson. Nice looking bike and easy to put together until I got to the front brakes. I couldn’t get the brake pads to be flush on the rim. Then I realized the brake calipers on one side was bent preventing the pads to be straight. Don’t know if this was defective from the factory or from when they shipped it to me. I’m hoping Amazon does the right thing and sends me a replacement so my grandson can enjoy his birthday gift safely.
customer_reviews.author: Saritza

customer_reviews.title: Junk bike and Dangerous.  Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my 9 year old daughter in Dec 2019. The assembly was easy, but then again I have put together many bikes. She started using the bike this Spring and it is already broken. The handlebars completely split in two while she was riding on a hill! I tried to contact the Seller but no information is available. Total crap. Go to your local bike store instead. Buying a bike is a personal purchase that should not be low quality due to the safety risks associated with junk. Avoid at all costs!
customer_reviews.author: Tony T.

customer_reviews.title: Shipped to us with bent back wheel
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t figure out why it was so hard to get the brakes adjusted for this bike. I put it together with my 10 year old son, his first real bike, and I made a big production of it. We got it together, and agree adjusting the breaks for 20 minutes, he started to ride down the street a couple of yards. He was having problems and saying it was not moving. Upon closer inspection, I realized the entire back wheel was bent. This bike was shipped to us with a bent back wheel. It was heartbreaking for my son and ruined our day.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hasty

customer_reviews.title: ... my 6 yr old granddaughter and it is an awesome bike. She doesn't like pink or purple
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 yr old granddaughter and it is an awesome bike. She doesn't like pink or purple, and all girls bike are pink or purple, except this one!! This is a very nice white with white wheels, and a few colorful designs on it. I put it together by myself on Christmas Eve (61 yr old Nana) and it was pretty easy. Almost put together out of the box. Just a few "major " parts to be put on.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike last year for my son's birthday. The assembly was not that easy but I was able to do it after a few hours. My son is 7, so he did not do tricks or anything, just riding on the sidewalk slowly. After riding it for a week or two, the rear brake cable was broken, so the bike has been sitting in the backyard without any use. The bike shops ask $100 for fixing the brakes and I have zero experience in fixing that kind of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Scientist

customer_reviews.title: Useless assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: So the actual product is good however, the directions to assemble were ABSOLUTELY WORTHLESS! The were unrecognizable pictures and the written instructions were ridiculous and confusing. The handle bars needed to be rebuilt because the came assembled backwards and there were not enough nuts to put the whole thing together. I am very mechanically inclined and this assembly was horrible. Very disappointed. Once fully assembled the brakes are not great either.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Hancock

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was simple. After unboxing, the bike was basically in (3) pieces including “preassembled frame, front forks, rear wheel, and brake”. The only things needed to assemble is the handlebars, peddles, and front wheel. Simple! This bike does not have coaster brakes. The only braking mechanism is the hand brake for the rear wheel. Adjustments: For better hand reach, and so my kid can reach the brake handle better, I slid the handbrake handle away from the hand grip about 1” and this brought the lever in closer, and I also adjusted the brake lever set screw which brought the brake handle in even tighter to the handle bar. Tiny kid tiny hands, need to be able to stop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Part missing & a crack on the break!
customer_reviews.text: Please contact me to raspberrymiran@gmail.com As you see in the pictures attached, a hex nut on the brake system is missing. Because of that, the brake system on the front moves around quite a lot. Also, the screw casing on the brake wire leading to the handle is cracked, and the wire has popped out of place a few times. Please contact me ASAP, or I need to return the item! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Miran Oh

customer_reviews.title: No better than huffy or kent now
customer_reviews.text: The frame and forks, wheels etc. are solid but the rear brake is complete junk. One of the screws stripped during assembly and I had to buy some parts at the hardware store to make it work. I remember when Mongoose was a quality bike. No better than huffy or kent now.
customer_reviews.author: In the know

customer_reviews.title: Brakes don’t work
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking bike but beware . Brakes do not work. The brake lever is so hard for my son to pull and brakes do not stop him making it unsafe for him to ride. Even for me being a grown adult it is hard to pull the brake lever. I took the bike to my local bike shop to get them adjusted and the guy said the brakes on these bikes (mongoose bmx) never work properly and there is no way of fixing the issue . It’s been too long since we ordered to return bike so we might be out of luck here, but I just wanted to warn others for the safety of their kids
customer_reviews.author: Joel Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: Defective manufacturing, no quality control
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. No quality control of their products. Literally the first part of assembly was impossible due to the handlebar tube being bent during manufacturing. This was not damaged from shipping either. This was a blatantly obvious defect which means these bikes are not being inspected after they are manufactured. Mongoose had a good reputation when I was a kid as having great quality bikes, and the very first one i bought for one of my kids was immediately defective and impossible to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: DieselCalves

customer_reviews.title: You get less than you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Mongoose is not what it once was. This thing is heavy as a tank. The instruction booklet is miserable (it’s written for several of their bikes and you have to decipher which applies to you). Unless you are putting bikes together frequently, this will take you a couple hours to put together. Bike looks great but that’s about it. Realistic cost is about $80.
customer_reviews.author: TheseNuts

customer_reviews.title: Bearings messed up. 2 tries and both junk
customer_reviews.text: This is second mongoose that is trash. First one in Christmas day he could barely pedal at 9 years old because of crank bearings so tight. This one I checked before putting together and front bearings clicking and feels like its notched to stop at certain spots through the bearings. Returning second one. Done giving this company a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Technician Recommended on brakes
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. Braking system is way different from a normal bike brake system. I hired the technician The Bike Dude through Amazon and He never saw a braking system like this but he explained how it works and how to tighten the brake line. He got on the bike and played on it to make sure everything was perfect before he left. Recommend the technician for this bike
customer_reviews.author: 02ANGELS

customer_reviews.title: Why would anyone trust their child to this bike?!
customer_reviews.text: This is a flimsy, shoddy bicycle. The wheels have no tread right out of the box. The seat’s cheap thin cover was torn at the corner before assembly. And most horrifyingly, the first time he rode it THE FRONT BREAK ASSEMBLE REFUSED TO DISENGAGE AND THEN SNAPPED OFF. As you can see in the picture the aluminum housing screw had an air bubble or crack and simply snapped off. Thank god for the helmet. I wonder if he will ever ride a bike again after this.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon De VITO

customer_reviews.title: Son likes it
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old son put it together easily. I checked everything and we went for a bike ride that day. Not as heavy as I thought it would be. Considered buying a second one as a spare or for relatives.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL D DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Might be better to purchase it in Walmart
customer_reviews.text: The bike comes in needs assembling, but no tool provided (a cheap set of wrenches would help). The manual is generic and not specific to the bike we purchased. Both brakes are terribly misaligned and took a long time to adjust. The seat angle is not adjustable at all, and my daughter slides down the bike all the time. Might be better to buy it at Walmart already assembled, so you can at least pick one that works.
customer_reviews.author: L. Yin

customer_reviews.title: My son LOVES this bike!!
customer_reviews.text: Negatives first. The chain protector broke first day. The brakes don't stop on a dime. That being said, this bike is so great!! My son loves zipping around the whole neighborhood. He's almost 6 and about 42 inches and it's the perfect size. I called Amazon about the bike chain cover and they sent me a brand new bike with 30 days to return the other for free!! (Best company ever.) He's figured out how to navigate the brake thing and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: El Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Great bike.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. All reviews about weight and breaks complains are misleading. Breaks needs to be adjusted. Weight is reasonable for the recommended age. Even on an adult bike, fitting is necessary. Pedal are plastic and might break over time as mentioned in the reviews. However, the quality of the bike is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Mongoose Legion Mag 20"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike to ride around with my (almost) 6 year old and my 3 year old. I'm about 5'10" and about 200 pounds. I really just wanted something fun that reminded me a being a kid. This bike is doing the job. Just got it today and it was well packaged with no damage. It was easy to put together, took about 30 minutes in all. It feels nice and sturdy. It is a little small, but nothing I didn't expect. I'm not planning on doing any tricks with this bike. I road it for about an hour today and it was a blast. Kids even jumped on the pegs for a short ride.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old son. He loves it! I personally like the grey color. In certain light is has the Note 10 color tint to it. The front forks where slightly bent likely in transit but I was able to clamp with a large crescent wrench to bend the wheel axle mount tabs back into place. Seems to be a bike that will last my son a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for our 9 year old Bday. He’s average size. He loves it. He said it’s a little big for him but it works. Lol My son put it together. He said putting the brakes together wasn’t easy. He’s a very handy person. A beginner would for sure need help. I give the bike 5 out of 5 stars. It is beautiful. Steady. And the kids love it. I’d say bye it.
customer_reviews.author: Surfer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Angry
customer_reviews.text: Went out to the garage on Christmas Eve to assemble this bike and I discovered it came with no assembly instructions, and no peddles. Very disappointed that I was unable to have a bike next to the tree for my son on Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: X Rater

customer_reviews.title: Bad main hub
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my daughter's birthday. Assembled per instructions and tried the pedals, there was a catch and a grinding noise coming from the main hub. Disassembled, adjusted per the manual, still not better. Disassembled and adjusted again, adding grease, and there is still bearing noise and a dragging feel. Bike seems nice, but looking to return as I don't trust the hub.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

customer_reviews.title: I got the bike for my son for Christmas. ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the bike for my son for Christmas. Today, which is Christmas Eve I went to assemble the bike and the front tire is flat. I inflated the tire and finished the bike, when done the front tire was flat again. So with no where to get a bike tube late Christmas Eve I will have to take one off his old bike and replace the new defective one. Thanks for the extra work.
customer_reviews.author: David Rimmer

customer_reviews.title: Brakes were in a locked positio when arrived.
customer_reviews.text: the Brakes came in a locked setting and we had to have the bike serviced to fix the issue. Once the bike was fixed, it has been great and is very sturdy. Very disappointed that we had to spend money to fix a new bike....
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: This bike has terrible brakes. Safety hazard! Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: The bikes brakes do not stop. they only slow you down. this is huge safety hazard! I went so far as to take it to a bike shop, replaced the brake lever and brake pads... still no stopping. It it a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Manufacturing defect! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the bike as the front fork axel had been welded on backwards. I took the time to see if other buyers have written on this issue and there are SEVERAL reviews indicating a manufacturing defect in the front axel area. One reviewer even mentioned the front wheel breaking off while her son was riding the bike. DO NOT BUY...amazon should not allow this seller to continue selling these defective and unsafe bikes!
customer_reviews.author: Roula G

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: The bike looks great, but is extremely heavy. The handle bars can’t be raised or lowered. The seat should lower an extra 2 inches. The wheels have a lot of friction when spinning and wobble a little bit. Maybe I am just expecting to much, but I am disappointed in the build quality. I had a mongoose bike 20 years ago that was about the same size that was way nicer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Skousen

customer_reviews.title: kid loved it
customer_reviews.text: Neighborhood group on FB posted someone stole their neighbors kids orange and black mongoose he got with his birthday money from wal-mart, asking people to be on look. I kept thinking about that post and a week later messaged and asked if his bike had been found and it hadn't. I remained anonymous through the neighbor and she reported back that the kid was super gateful, and thought this bike was even better than the one he got at walmart which was stolen. best purchase ever
customer_reviews.author: evan

customer_reviews.title: Damaged box & Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike but box was damaged upon arrival. Full of holes and missing a nut for the front wheel to mount on the forks. Probably due to the holes in the box. Not to mention the stripped bolt on the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: TDDM

customer_reviews.title: Faulty and unsafe
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed. We purchases this bike for my son. The goose neck wasn't welded correctly and the bar was bent so the it would move from side to side. This caused the handlebars to be able to move and not stay secure. My son took it down a ramp and it came loose and he took a nasty spill because the handle bars twisted. My husband got a replacement piece and it seems to be fixed. However. Paying 200 bucks for a bike that came faulty is super annoying and unsafe!
customer_reviews.author: Main Account

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Product came missing two important screws which ruined Christmas Day for my son but now we took to the bike store to have it fixed. Otherwise a cute bike
customer_reviews.author: Viviane

customer_reviews.title: Defective parts!
customer_reviews.text: The handle bar bolt is stripped out and will not tighten all the way down. We constantly have to tighten just so the handlebars done move. This part of bike came assembled so it was shipped that way. Update.... the seat will not stay up/tightened. The kickstand slips forward and doesn’t hold the bike up. More problems than its worth.
customer_reviews.author: andrea n

customer_reviews.title: Nice BMX bike from Mongoose.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike. Use the right tools, installation is a breeze. You must install pedals, handle bars, seat, front tire, pegs, light reflectors, and attach the brake line from hand brake to the gyro. The front forks seems like it was bent, but I just needed to angle the fork onto the tire and re-adjust the handle bar. My 9 year old loves it and by raising the seat and handle bar heights, this bike will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: SGT Airborne

customer_reviews.title: Overall a pretty solid bike
customer_reviews.text: Overall a pretty solid bike, be sure to tighten the handlebars A LOT those 4 bolts need to be tight. The paint on the Teeth where the chain touches the sprocket is now worn off after a few rides. The bottom bracket cranks and sprocket are very basic (as expected) Not sure how long they will last with me romping on it... a great little bike, very clean looking :)
customer_reviews.author: kelli frey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect BMX bike for kids
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this bike for my son’s 9th birthday. It arrived on time and the assembly was easy. Very cool looking bike and he loves it!!! Only issue I have is the 4 bolts that hold the handle bars in place. They can strip very easy, so be carful not to tighten them too tight. Other then that, it’s a very nice bike for kids. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: DJ Royal

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: The item came with a bent back rim. Doesn’t work and impossible to get beck in a box and return.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer2020

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS BIKE!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very VERY bad purchase. Do NOT buy this bike. It comes partially assembled but the part they assemble was done incorrectly. You're going to spend what the bike costs just to get it riding. STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.author: Milky

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed for the quality, but my son loved it.
customer_reviews.text: This bike was a Christmas present for my son. We got delivery and put into the attic still in the box until Christmas Eve. Pull it out of the box (yes maybe should’ve check it before Christmas Eve) put it together. There where several scratches on the frame. Go to air up the tires and one does not inflate. Take it apart and the tube had huge holes. Looks like it was pinched during packing. It’s Christmas Eve no options to go bye a new one. Luckily we had an extra tube not the correct size. So at least the tire wasn’t flat on Christmas morning!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Zell

customer_reviews.title: 9yo approved
customer_reviews.text: The directions I received didn’t match the bike I bought. I had to YouTube some info on it. I put it together in 1hour or so. My son loves it! It is his favorite color orange and big enough to make him feel like an older “cool big kid”. He is 9 haha.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but nice looking
customer_reviews.text: The bike is heavier than my adult sized hybrid bike. It's sturdy and the no tangle brakes are such a huge. My 8 year old is tall, so he rides it without a problem and it has plenty of room for him to grow as long as he takes care of it. Was easy to assemble. I only had to make a minor adjustment to the brakes.
customer_reviews.author: TheArtisticRat

customer_reviews.title: Cheap made
customer_reviews.text: I will never purchase another mongoose bicycle, the first time the bearings fell out after 2 days. This bike, when pulling the brake lever the threads pulled the cable through stripping and ruining the threads on the housing and the adjustment cable. Mongoose = TRASH.
customer_reviews.author: nadia barker

customer_reviews.title: Can take a beating
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions were a bit difficult to interpret (I've put bikes together before). The booklet contained instructions for several models. I had a rough time figuring out which to use. Ugh. That being said, Mongoose is the best. Typical Mongoose quality AND alloy rims. Huzzah.
customer_reviews.author: SisterMaryPollyEsther

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: These Mongoose bikes are perfect for kids 7 and up. I bought two for my 6 and 9 year old. It’s a little big for a 6 year old, but she’s handling it fine and will grow into it within months. For my 9 year old it’s exactly what you’d expect. These bikes are well built and easy to assemble. Always go with a proven company when purchasing products on Amazon. Worth it and then some.
customer_reviews.author: ty

customer_reviews.title: Solid beginner bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike is excellent. Havnt seen many reviews on it but this is perfect for a beginner biker when it comes to hitting the skatepark. Nice thick tires to prevent a flat and small sprocket to ensure it doesnt get screwed up while practicing drop ins. Would recommend as a great starter bike for a young one.
customer_reviews.author: ginger

customer_reviews.title: Brake is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Got this bike today and assembled it pretty quick. My 5 year old rode it to the park and all the way complained about the brake. Sure enough the brake is stiff as hell. I tried so much to adjust it. He ran straight into a pole because it required so much force for him to apply the brake. Wonder who designed this for 5-8 year old. I am writing this review from the park and this bike is going back. As someone mentioned this is a safety hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid build
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a great little BMX bike to help your child transfer from 16 inch to an 18 inch, then look no further, the Mongoose Legion 18 has it! Double walled rims, 2.40 tires, slim pedal set, cassette rear hub, front load head set with 7.25 rise bars and Tekro brakes just like it's older brother. But this bike model will still stick to it's one piece crank and ball & cage bearings. After stripping the chain guard and reflectors off the bike, we weighed the bike in at 18 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn K. August Kahakelii

customer_reviews.title: Great started BMX bike.
customer_reviews.text: It’s kind of a heavy bike nothing crazy. But I have to say it is definitely really sturdy. Very easy to put together. Getting the brakes tight enough for a stop take some time to understand. Adjust them at the center connector. Took a while to get. And the really cool part about it is it reminds me of one mongoose was made here in the states.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Walker

customer_reviews.title: Birthday surprise
customer_reviews.text: This bike was a birthday present for my grandson who’s birthday is July 31st. He is tall for his age and needed at 24” bike. After not being able to find one in the local stores, I ordered one, but the shipping date said it wouldn’t be delivered until Sept 26th. To our surprise, the bike was delivered July 26th! It was in time for his birthday, what a great surprise!! The bike was easy to assemble and will work great for his needs.
customer_reviews.author: james hathcock

customer_reviews.title: Bad brakes should have listened to other reviews.
customer_reviews.text: The brakes on this bike are horrible. When turning the wheel and applying pressure they seem to stop the back wheel. Once my 50 lb son got in the bike they were useless and dangerous. I’ve spent two hours or more trying to fix this. I used to build Bmx bikes years ago and did my own brakes easily. These are something else. Now I’m stuck w sending it back or spending $100 or so at local bike store. 👎🏻 Bummer for the gift to my son.
customer_reviews.author: Andy C.

customer_reviews.title: Handlebar broke off
customer_reviews.text: Picture says it all. This is after only one month of riding.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Brakes do not work. Instructions don’t match product
customer_reviews.text: After following assembly instructions that are seemingly for a different model bicycle and having 3 different people try to adjust the brakes, the brakes still do not work.
customer_reviews.author: Rachey Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but may not be for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality but dont think its for beginners. The installation instructions are not too helpful. The seat is way too hard for kids and the breaks could be better.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: The first one we ordered had a bad pedal and I could not get it to thread ...
customer_reviews.text: The first one we ordered had a bad pedal and I could not get it to thread on to the bike so we had to send it back and order another. The second was fine and the bike is well made and rides great the brakes can be a bit tricky to get them adjusted but other than that the bike is nice!
customer_reviews.author: Aron

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.text: Bad buy. My son needed a bike to mess around on when he wasn't racing his top of the line BMX race bike. This bike lasted a couple of months before the welded metal piece on the top tube that holds the brake cable snapped. I see no way of fixing it. Complete manufacturing failure. Waste of money. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Huneke

customer_reviews.title: My brother loves the bike a little too much
customer_reviews.text: Brother loves this freaking bike and won't stop riding it... It's to the point he is riding it into movie theaters and jumping over people lol jk he just loves the bike alot
customer_reviews.author: Yami_Industries

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bike and was easy to assemble. Most of it is already assembled in the box, you just put on the front wheel, seat and peddles and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bike just have a pro assemble it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a birthday gift for my grandson who loved it. However, the breaks were hard to assemble and I had a difficult time with the bolt that keeps the handle bar locked in place.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great, solid bike
customer_reviews.text: We found it really easy to put the non-connected pieces together. It was almost assembled. I think a tire and the handle bars were all we needed to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Erin G

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Bike = Happy Son
customer_reviews.text: This bike was a great investment... It was easy to assemble & my favorite thing is the brakes are perfect... I can't wait to have my son take it for a ride 👌👍👊
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Honga

customer_reviews.title: Products improven't and developen't over time!!??
customer_reviews.text: Very, very disappointed...brakes suck; cranks suck; handle bars suck; neck sucks!! Not Mongoose i had as a kid in the 80s. I had this crazy mindset, and was deluted in thinking, that products DEVELOP and IMPROVE over time... WRONG!! POS!!
customer_reviews.author: jir

customer_reviews.title: Completely Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Never have I been so inclined to write a review... This thing was a completely waste of my time, the bike appears almost used ( see pictures). Very poor quality control, I'd say buy local and save yourself the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken

customer_reviews.title: Difficult braking! Caution
customer_reviews.text: Front brake is IMPOSSIBLE for most adults to pull, let alone a child. After all possible adjustments have been made, seems that the spring tension is way too strong. There’s nothing that can be done except for replacing the spring.

product_meta.title: Mongoose Legion Freestyle Sidewalk BMX Bike for-Kids, -Children and Beginner-Level to Advanced Riders, 16-20-inch Wheels, Hi-Ten Steel Frame, Micro Drive 25x9T BMX Gearing
product_meta.description: Color:Green| Style:Legion L16For 45 years, Mongoose has been in the dirt, down the trails, and on the ramps. With the Legion Series, Mongoose offers a full line of freestyle BMX bikes for riders of all ages and ability levels. The Legion L16 is designed to be a great introduction into the world of BMX. Putting the Hi-Ten steel construction and hard-wearing single-wall wheels to great use, this mighty Mongoose rolls through every park and across every sidewalk with style and speed. Fantastic for leveling up on your freestyle tricks and skills, this lightweight and reliable BMX keeps you well supported on every landing, with its aluminum rims and chunky tires absorbing every impact. This bike ships ready to be assembled.
feature_bullets: The Legion L16 is a great first BMX bike that features the geometry and feel preferred by today’s riders; Suggested rider height is 3'6" and smaller
The Legion L16 features a durable Hi-Ten steel frame with 15.3" top tube length
Drivetrain features a 130 mm one-piece crank with a 25T alloy chainring and American loose ball bearing bottom bracket
16” x 2.3” tires mounted on aluminum single wall 28H rims with 3/8” in axle front hub and 9T cog ball bearing cassette rear hub
Hi-Ten steel handlebar and fork, 40 mm stem, standard 1-1/8” headset, and aluminum U-brake
